translations.v: Oopsy! Ocorreu um erro em segundo plano! jogo agora pode estar instavel. Reinicie o jogo e ajude-nos ao reportar esse problema!
A madeira é um material de construção básico. Também pode ser processada em carvão vegetal em um forno de carvão vegetal.
O refugo não é apenas um material de construção básico para edifícios. Também pode ser usado para fabricar ferramentas ou para processar recursos especiais

O metal pode ser recuperado da sucata. É necessário um reciclador ou uma refinaria para fazer isso. O metal é um material mais robusto, usado principalmente para ferramentas aprimoradas ou edifícios especiais.
O plástico pode ser recuperado da sucata. É necessário um reciclador ou uma refinaria para fazer isso. É um material essencial para conter a radiação.
É possível recuperar eletrônicos da sucata. É necessário um reciclador ou uma refinaria para fazer isso. Os eletrônicos são usados ​​principalmente para a fonte de alimentação.
O pano pode ser recuperado da sucata. É necessário um reciclador ou uma refinaria para fazer isso. O pano é usado por um alfaiate para produzir roupas de proteção.

A água é a chave para a sobrevivência. A água pode ser coletada dos lagos por um cais, do solo por um poço ou da chuva por um coletor de água da chuva. Uma cisterna ou uma torre de água é necessária para distribuir a água dentro de um poço. o acordo
O fornecimento de uma ampla variedade de alimentos juntamente com ervas mantém seus colonos saudáveis ​​e reduz o risco de um surto de doença.
As bagas são colhidas pelos coletores e podem ser encontradas nas florestas.
Os cogumelos são colhidos pelos coletores e podem ser encontrados nas florestas.
As raízes são desenterradas pelos coletores e podem ser encontradas nas florestas.
Javalis fornecem carne de javali quando são mortos por um caçador.
Os veados fornecem Roe Venison se mortos por um caçador.
As ervas são colhidas pelos coletores e podem ser encontradas nas florestas.
A cerveja é produzida na taberna e serve para alegrar o humor dos colonos
Uma ferramenta importante para concluir as tarefas de trabalho no ambiente circundante.
Uma ferramenta mais avançada e com maior durabilidade para executar tarefas de trabalho em todo o local.
O carvão é feito de madeira usando um forno a carvão. Ele pode ser usado em uma torre de água para purificar a água e remover a radiação.
Lenços de pescoço protegem os colonos contra radiação de baixo nível.
Máscaras de carvão ativado protegem os colonos contra radiação de nível médio.
Os trajes de radiação protegem os colonos contra radiação de alto nível.
O feijão pode ser colhido nos campos.
O repolho pode ser colhido nos campos.
O milho pode ser colhido nos campos.
Os pimentões podem ser colhidos nos campos.
As batatas podem ser colhidas nos campos.
Abóboras gigantes podem ser colhidas nos campos.
A abóbora pode ser colhida nos campos.
O trigo pode ser colhido nos campos.
Maçãs podem ser colhidas em pomares.
As cerejas podem ser colhidas nos pomares
Pêssegos podem ser colhidos em pomares.
Peras podem ser colhidas em pomares.
Nozes-pecã podem ser colhidas em pomares.
As ameixas podem ser colhidas nos pomares.
Nozes podem ser colhidas em pomares.
Os peixes podem ser capturados nas cabanas de pesca

O cânhamo pode ser colhido nos campos. Ao contrário de outras culturas, o cânhamo não é uma fonte de alimento. O cânhamo é convertido em junções em um bar. Eles podem ser consumidos pelos colonos para aumentar sua confiança.
As juntas podem ser produzidas em uma taberna e consumidas pelos colonos para aumentar sua confiança.
O medicamento pode ser produzido em instalações médicas.
Rações da Expedição são pacotes de Comida e Água com os quais as Expedições podem ser equipadas para explorar repetidamente Ruínas antes que a Expedição precise retornar.
O licor duro pode ser produzido em uma taberna a partir de vários ingredientes.
A small Cabin in which Settlers can live and start a Family. Settlers only move in as a Family.
A sturdy house in which Settlers can live and start a Family. This Building has additional capacity to store Water and Food and can withstand more Sandstorms. Settlers only move in as a Family.
A large camp that can house a large number of Settlers, although it's not suitable for starting a Family.
A simple road that enables Settlers to make fast progress.
An paved road that enables Settlers to make faster progress.
An paved road that enables Settlers to travel faster and makes protection against toxic rain possible.
All kinds of Resources are kept in a Warehouse. This Building can't store Water.
A place to store raw materials like Wood, Scrap or Metal.
A central Building for distributing all of the Resources in the settlement. Logisticians collect Resources from the immediate vicinity of the Market.
An Expedition Station sends out Explorers to collect Resources and special objects at locations on the map.
A Cemetery offers Settlers a place where they can mourn their deceased relatives, which boosts their Confidence.

The Town Center is the heart of the settlement. It is able to store the most Resources and provides more capacity with each upgrade. Once the Town Center has been mounted, Settlers can meet there and boost their Confidence.
A Medical Facility attends to Settlers who are sick.
Starting at a certain age, a School provides Children with a place to learn and to become Educated Adults.
A Gatherer's Cabin accumulates Food from Plants in the forests.
A Hunting Lodge hunts wildlife for Food.
A Fishing Hut provides Food from caught fish, but can only be placed at the waterside.
An Orchard provides Food like fruits and nuts from trees. Although an Orchard can be created without construction costs, it needs time to allow its trees to grow.
A Covered Orchard provides Food like fruits and nuts from trees and can be covered to avoid toxic rain.
A Cultivated Field provides Food from farming Crops. Although a Field can be created without construction costs, it needs time to grow the Crops.
A Covered Field provides Food from farming Crops and can be covered to avoid toxic rain.
A Refinery simultaneously separates Metal, Cloth, Plastic or Electronics from Scrap.
A Scrapyard collects Scrap from Ruins in its immediate surroundings.
A Pub produces Beer, Liquor or Joints that can be consumed by Settlers to boost their Confidence.
A Tailor makes clothing that protects Settlers against Radiation.
A Workshop produces Tools that are needed to do any kind of work.
A Herbal Hut gathers Herbs in forests which can be used to improve the Settlers' Health.
A Forester's Lodge can either cut trees down to produce Wood or plant saplings to reforest a certain area, or do both.
A Charcoal Kiln produces Charcoal from Wood.

A Rainwater Collector collects Water from rain without requiring a workforce. It can be covered to avoid collecting toxic rain. A  Cistern or a Water Tower is necessary to distribute the Water within the settlement.
A Water Tower collects and stores Water. It can also use Charcoal to filter Radiation out of the Water. This Building requires a Jetty, a Well or a Rainwater Collector in order to function.
A Solar Collector generates a certain quantity of energy in order to supply the Building hooked up to the Power Grid with electricity.
A Power Line connects Buildings to a Power Grid.
A Battery stores energy during the daytime and returns it to the Power Grid at night.
A campfire is a meeting place for Settlers to boost their confidence.
A place to collect Water. Requires a Cistern or a Water Tower to collect and store Water.
A Stock of Resources that can be picked up and transfered to a storage building by Settlers.
A Well produces Water slowly and even during a drought. Wells that are built too close together have a negative impact on their respective efficiency.
A Recycler slowly separates Metal, Cloth, Plastic or Electronics from Scrap with low efficiency. Only one of these Resources can be separated at a time.

An Irrigation Plant System increases the soil moisture within its range of influence over time. This process consumes Water. The contamination level of the used Water also has influence on the earth radiation.
The Weather Station enables the decision to be made at which rain contamination level Fields and Rainwater Collectors should be covered. Additionally it provides a rain contamination forecast.

A Cistern collects and stores Water. This Building requires a Jetty, a Well or a Rainwater Collector to function.
Jetties and Wells are preferred to Rainwater Collectors when Water is collected.
Carries out simple Tasks and helps to transport Resources.
Needed in order to build a construction.
Explorers are not part of the general Profession Distribution. They can be assigned and sent on Expeditions using an Expedition Station. Explorers don't take over any work in the Settlement.
Scouts can either be sent to discover unknown locations or produce Expedition Rations in the Expedition Station.
Distributes all Resources at the Market.
Is needed in order to cure sick Settlers in a Medical Facility.
Gathers forest Plants as source of Food.
Refines Scrap to Metal, Electronics, Plastic or Cloth.
Produces Beer, Hard Liquor or Joints in a Pub.
Gathers Herbs from the forest that help to keep Settlers healthy.
Gathers Water from Jetties, Wells or Rainwater Collectors and conducts it to a Cistern or a Water Tower.
Children help their Families to transport Food and Water to their home.
Students learn at a School. When they have finished their educational training they are educated Adults and, as a result, work more effectively.
Adults can become active in Professions or help to transport Resources and carry out simple Tasks.
Takes care of dead Settlers and gives their relatives a place to mourn.
Operates pumps in a Well to ensure a steady flow of Water.
Supplies the Irrigation Plant System with Water from Cisterns or Water Towers.
Settler's home is being supplied with Electricity.
Settler is married to a much older partner.
Settler is infertile due to old age.
Settler is infertile due to suffering from high-level Radiation.
A relative of this Settler died and has no grave.
The Settler's home is severely damaged.
Settler experienced something good during an expedition.
Orders Settlers to gather all the Wood, small Scrap Piles and all the Plants from one area. This produces less outcome than using the particular production buildings.
Orders Settlers to gather all the Wood from one area. This produces less outcome than using a Forester’s Lodge.
Orders Settlers to gather small Scrap Piles from one area. This produces less outcome than using a Scrapyard.
Orders all unassigned Settlers to dig up the soil in a certain area in order to remove the Radiation there.
Orders Settlers to gather Forest Plants such as Berries, Mushrooms or Herbs. This produces less outcome than using a Gatherer's Cabin.
Settlers with low level of Confidence
Gives this Building the highest priority for all Builders. They take care of constructing this Building as soon as they have completed their current Tasks.
Gives this Building the highest priority for all Builders. They take care of repairing this Building as soon as they have completed their current Tasks.
No demographic change since the pioneers settled.
Changes the timeframe for the Production and Consumption Statistics below
Graphs and more detailed statistics about settlers and resources coming soon
Rain (unknown contamination! Build a Weather Station for forecasts)
Settlers with Tools work more effectively. Without Tools, production in the settlement is slowed down drastically.
Settlers wearing Protective Clothing are not exposed to Radiation when they wander around. Better Protective Clothing protects against higher levels of Radiation.
Educated Settlers perform their Professions much more effectively than uneducated Settlers.

Resources that can't be collected in the immediate vicinity:
<<missingResources>>
No Workforce available. Click to open Worker Disposition or assign directly to this Building.
Production Limit of this resource is reached
No Builders available. Click to open Professionals Menu or assign directly to this Building.
The work in this Building has paused
The Storage Capacity in this Building is running low
Missing resources to repair this building
Settlers are the backbone of the settlement. Whereas Children help their parents to store goods at their homes, parents can either take over simple gathering Tasks or adopt a Profession.
The sum of all positive buffs that affect total Confidence.
The sum of all negative buffs that affect total Confidence.

Your settlement has not survived the hardships of the new world. 

Your Settlers lived for <<years>> Seasons after the Endzone.
The preview version of "Endzone" ends here. Thanks for playing!
Regions not exposed to Radiation can be crossed by Settlers safely.
Regions exposed to Low-level Radiation contaminate Settlers slowly. They can protect themselves by wearing a Neck Scarf.
Regions exposed to Medium-level Radiation contaminate Settlers quickly. They can protect themselves by wearing an Activated Carbon Mask.
Regions exposed to High-level Radiation are extremely dangerous. Settlers who don't wear a Radiation Suit will be quickly contaminated.
Dried-out soil lets Fields, Orchards and forest Plants wither away.
Dry soil diminishes the growth of Fields, Orchards and forest Plants.
Moist soil is good for Field, Orchard and forest Plant growth.
Fields, Orchards and forest Plants grow faster on wet soil.
Activate/Deactivate Electricity to relieve the connected Power Grid
In-stock inventory of all logistics Buildings in the settlement

Children help their Families to transport Food and Water to their home. 
Next Childs to become Adults:
A low level of Confidence slows down population growth. Settlers can cheer themselves up in community Buildings.
A low level of Health increases the risk that a disease breaks out and weakens production, because affected Settlers move slower.
A high level of Radiation lets Settlers' Health dwindle away. In addition, Settlers become infertile or die from the high level of Radiation.
Gives this Building the highest priority for all Builders. They take care of demolishing this Building as soon as they have completed their current Tasks.
Show or hide the Game Log
<<name>> grew up and became an Adult.
<<name>> finished School and is now an educated Adult.
and was replaced by another Settler.
and couldn't be replaced by any other Settler.
<<name>> had to drop out of School prematurely and is now an Uneducated Adult.
The Geiger counter displays the average Radiation in the current field of view.
The water meter displays the amount of stored Water in all of the settlememt's Water Towers and Rainwater Collectors.
The production limit for Water. When the production limit is reached, all Water Carriers join in to help perform simple Tasks in the settlement.
Focus the previous building of this type with the camera
Focus the next building of this type with the camera
The amount of resources that is reserved to be picked up by settlers for consumption or work tasks.
Current and maximum number of workers
Total number of workers in this Profession in the settlement

Our Scouts discovered an interesting-looking building at one of the abandoned sites. It wasn't in good condition. That's why we ought to take the right Tools with us. Maybe some basic construction material might come in handy, too, just in case we have to find another way in.

It's a pretty run-down building - the roof has partially caved in. On the other hand, the sign in front looks like one we had on the doors to the medical ward in the Endzone. Could be worth taking a look!
We should try to find a way to get in. Maybe we'll find some material.
Use the Tools we brought along to get in through the door.
We forced the door open. Maybe we'll find something inside.
We didn't find anything. But we could try again in a few days.
Let's try to climb in through the roof!
We climbed in through a hole in the roof and no one was hurt! Maybe we can find something inside.
Damn it, chief! One of us burst through the roof and busted a leg! But we did manage to open the door from the inside. Maybe we can find something.
We found a way in. It's time to search through everything!
Let's take a look in the library!
We found some interesting books! Maybe we can learn something about Medicine from them.
Unfortunately, we didn't find anything useful. <<dynamicmessage>>
Maybe we might find something if we come back with someone who's smarter.
Let's take a look at the operating table!
We found several types of medications and some electronic devices! That could really help in the event of an epidemic.
Unfortunately, we didn't find anything useful. <<dynamicmessage>>
Maybe we might find something if we come back with someone who has a good grasp of this subject.
Maybe we'll find something if we search the surrounding area...
Let's take a look in the backyard
We found some Scrap we can use.
We didn't find anything, but we could try again some other time!
Maybe we'll find more doors inside the House.
We found the entrance to the basement. The door was hidden behind vines.
We didn't find any other entrance, but we can try again some other time.
Maybe we'll find something in the front yard...
We didn't find anything, but we could try again some other time!
Maybe we can find something down there.
Let's take a look down there. Looks like the basement is contaminated.
Everything went smoothly! We found some Seeds down there!
Some of us have been contaminated with Radiation. But we did find some Seeds down there!

It’s a nuclear power plant! Those things devastated the world. Our elders told us that we ought to stay clear of them, but there still must be valuable Resources waiting inside. At the very least we'll need Tools and protective gear to get in.

Looks almost peaceful, if it weren't for the caved-in roof. That must've been one big bang! The remnants have still got to be emitting tons of Radiation. Just listen to that Geiger counter! <<dynamicmessage>>
Are you sure that we should be spending any time here? All of us ought to be wearing Radiation Suits if we don't want to catch the "sickness".
We can try to climb up the giant door to break in. <<dynamicmessage>> There's a rusty ladder up to the roof, too. From there we could try getting into the dome through the hole.
Although it's going to be hard to open it with our bare hands.
Find a way into the reactor core!
Try to force the door open!
The door couldn't do a thing to stop the crowbar. Now the Geiger counter's going bananas. Are you really sure about this?
This door may be old, but it still won't budge an inch. <<dynamicmessage>> Maybe we can find another way into the reactor core...
If we only had the right Tools with us...
We could climb up that rusty ladder! <<dynamicmessage>>
But you know what, chief? We're not what you'd call nimble!

The ladder broke apart as the last of us was climbing up it. But we made it. Now we can climb down to the core. You're sure about this, right? The Radiation level must still be incredibly high! We can see chunks of graphite all over the place...
The ladder broke apart while climbing up! Luckily, no one was seriously injured. Just a few bruises and a dislocated shoulder. What's worse: We won't get in this way.
There's an empty pool, some old tubes and machinery, and a room full of displays and control panels. But the needle on the Geiger counter keeps spiking like wild...
This looks like a control room. It ought to be full of electronic equipment. <<dynamicmessage>>
Without protection it's a tough call!
This almost looks like the central control room we had back in the Endzone. In any case, we can definitely put all this old technology to good use!
The air had a metallic taste to it, and all of us are already feeling queasy. We grabbed a few loose electronic parts on the way out. We didn't want to leave absolutely empty-handed...
That machine with all those tubes must be a heat exchanger. We can use the Metal it's made of. <<dynamicmessage>>
Without protection it's a tough call!
It took some effort, but in the end we were able to take the whole machine apart. Lots of valuable Metal!
I think this whole place is still highly contaminated, chief. We had to leave quickly, but the first symptoms are already evident.
This airlock should get us into the generator room. The Geiger counter's going off like crazy. <<dynamicmessage>>
Thanks for remembering to pack those suits for us, chief!
Without protection it's a tough call!

We've passed the airlock now. This must have been the generator room before the roof got blown away. All the machinery was destroyed. There's not much left except for wreckage that has to be salvaged. But there are other doors here, too...
That was a bad idea, chief. Some of us are already showing symptoms of the sickness, and we got out of there in a hurry when the Geiger counter started clicking like crazy.

Seems to be all locked-in. There are a couple of roller doors and a side entrance that we could get in through. Our Scout told us it might also be possible to climb up onto the roof and get in from there.
We can try getting in from there! But this symbol is kind of alarming... <<dynamicmessage>>
Without protection it's a tough call!

Beyond the long corridor we entered the room where the generator must have stood before the roof was torn off. All the machinery was destroyed. There's not much left except for wreckage that has to be salvaged. But there are other doors here, too...
Listen to that Geiger counter, chief! Some of us are getting really scared, and we're not going to leave anyone behind here. <<dynamicmessage>>
We ought to come back with better equipment.
There's supposed to be a storage depot behind those doors. <<dynamicmessage>>
The only drawback is that we don't have any suitable Tools. We'll give it a try, anyway!

It was pretty easy to force the old doors open. Now we're standing in some kind of storage depot - there's all sorts of old machinery and an old truck standing around, and a long corridor leads further inside. Oh, and there's a row of doors at the other end of the hall.

These doors are heavier than they look! We managed to hoist them just far enough so that the skinniest one of us could squeeze through and take a couple of small things from inside. We'd be better off finding a different entrance...
What kind of doors are there?
Okay, the floor collapsed in the middle and there's a row of really sturdy doors on the side of the room.
A collapsed floor that leads to a kind of decontamination room. We could rope some towels together to get down there! <<dynamicmessage>>
If we only had some! But we could still risk it by climbing down.

That was close! The last of us nearly fell on top of the group, but at the last moment he latched onto something. <<dynamicmessage>> There are lots of dusty Radiation Suits lying around here! They should prove to come in handy...
Good thing we had a rope.

Damn it, chief, the last of us slipped and fell on top of the whole group. Hit us really hard. We'd be better off heading back... <<dynamicmessage>> This room is full of Radiation Suits, but we were only able to take a few of them with us...
Next time, please don't send us down there without a rope.
We should be able to get into the rest of the facility through these doors!
Now we're standing in some kind of storage depot - there's all sorts of old machinery and an old truck in here. Oh, and a row of doors at the other end.
Now we're standing in some kind of Storage Depot. There's all sorts of old machinery and an old truck standing around. Oh, and a row of doors at the other end.
That door might lead further inside... <<dynamicmessage>>
But we need to be careful since we're not very well protected...

This must have been the generator room before the whole roof was torn off. All the machinery has been destroyed. There's not much left to salvage except for wreckage. But there are other doors here, too...

I'm sorry, chief, but we can't go in there. It's a long and dark corridor where the sound of the Geiger counter and the sign on the door constantly remind us what a bad idea this is. <<dynamicmessage>>
If there's no other choice, we could come back properly equipped.
But it could be tough to get in because we don't have the right Tools on hand...
Yes! No door can stop us! We're in a much smaller storage room, but guess what we found in a couple of lockers: Radiation Suits and masks! They really ought to come in handy.
We can't do a thing, chief. This door won't budge a bit. <<dynamicmessage>>
If we only had the right Tools along...
We can definitely use the parts. <<dynamicmessage>>
And we've brought along an expert!
<<dynamicmessage>> I'd say we've stripped this thing down completely. That's going to prove to be useful back in camp!
Good thing we have someone with us who knows how to strip down these machines!
Okay, I think we pretty much took along everything we can carry. All that's left are a few big parts that are just too heavy. <<dynamicmessage>>
We simply don't know how we can dismantle them.
Talk about an aging beauty! Time to crank up those old engines!
<<dynamicmessage>> But our Technician did manage to strip the engine down into valuable parts!
Pardon the wise crack. That thing is never going to run again.
Pardon the wise crack. That thing is in good shape, but not good enough by far. We've stripped the truck for parts instead.
It must be a turbine. Except that it's ten times bigger than the one we used to generate power in the Endzone. Just imagine the output alone!
We can try to strip that thing down into individual parts!
Phew, that was a lot of work. We managed to break the thing up, and all the parts are in amazingly good shape!
There's no way we'll be able to take the turbine apart. That thing is heavy and much too large. We'll take some of the other stuff lying around here and head back.
Maybe there's something useful in those barrels.
Some of them seem to contain Water, but the Geiger counter is going crazy! We'd be best off just staying away from those barrels. But we can take the empty ones along with us.

We accidentally tipped one over while trying to open the lid, and now Water has spilled out all over the place. We took off when the Geiger counter started clicking, but some of us suddenly don't feel well at all.
We could climb up onto the roof and get in from there! <<dynamicmessage>>

Climbing up was easy. Climbing down from the hole in the roof was a different story, but we made it. Now we're standing in the generator room. All the machinery has been destroyed. There's not much left to salvage except for wreckage. But there are other doors here, too...

Climbing up was easy. But while climbing down a platform crashed with one of us on it. Although we've made it to the generator room, we've got a broken leg on our hands now, too! There are doors here. We'd be better off trying to get out of here again, chief!
But we're not in the best shape...
Cancels all "Remove Radiation" Tasks in a certain area.
Raw material can be used either for constructions or for conversion into other Resources or products.
Providing a wide variety of Foods together with Herbs keeps your Settlers healthy and lowers the risk of a disease outbreak.

Water is the key to survival. Water can be collected from Lakes via a Jetty, from the ground via a Well, or from rain via a Rainwater Collector. A Cistern or a Water Tower is neccessary to distribute the Water within the settlement.
Radiation protection keeps your Settlers healthy by shielding them against Radiation from the surrounding environment when they move around.
Tools are important in order to increase your Settlers' producitvity.
Make medication like Herbs or Medicine available so that your Settlers can get healthy again.
Orders your Builders to remove all roads in a certain area.
Builders demolish marked Buildings. Demolishing a Building recovers some of the Resources that were originally used for construction.

Now we wish. To catch a fish. So juicy sweet!
Not to be mistaken for a mole.

Start gathering Resources from the surroundings so that <<villageName>> can continue to grow.
Children help their Families to transport Food and Water to their home. They can be educated in a School as long as they are childs to make them grow up to educated Adults.

Young Adults are Settlers that recently became Adults and are potential new workforce that can be distributed to different Professions. If they are provided with a suitable place to start a family they try to find a partner to grow the population of the settlement.

Adults are Settlers, that might be old enough to have proven themselves worthy in a specific profession. In this case they are rewarded with a Badge. Adults are still fertile and might help to grow the population of the settlement.
Old Adults are no longer fertile and can't help to grow the population of the settlement anymore. They are likely to be rewarded with a Badge for a specific Profession.
Very Old Adults will die any time soon. If there are free Settlers available in case of their Death they can be replaced in their current Profession.
This Settler has passed away. A Mortician should burry this Settler to give his relatives a place to mourn.
